DeregistrationReasonOtherText: EPA has administratively marked this facility 'closed'.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Executive Summary is attached as a Microsoft Word file, aee 33298.621
The accidental release prevention and emergency policies:  Carpenter Industries, Incorporated, complies with National Fire Protection Association Document # 58 (NFPA-58) requirements for LP-Gas storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Wayne County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC), the Richmond Fire Department (RFD), and the National Response Center and Indiana Department of Environmental Management (IDEM), as necessary.

Facility description and the regulated substance:  Carpenter Industries is a manufacturer of buses and related motor vehicles, employing approximately 550 people.  Propane is used only as a backup fuel source in the event that the natural gas source is interrupted.

The worst-case release scenario:  The worst-case scenario for Carpenter Industries is failure of a 20,000 gallon above-ground storage tank containing propane.  The facility cannot store more than 17,600 gallons in the tank.  A vapor cloud explosion of this tank would result in an endpoint distance of 0.3 miles.  A total of approximately 300 people would potentially be affected.

The prevention program:  Carpenter Industries complies with the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The propane system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and applicable state law.

Five-year accident history:  Franklin Electric has never had an accident involving propane that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.

The emergency response program:  In the event of an emergency involving our propane system, it is our policy to notify the Wayne County LEPC, the RFD and the appropriate state and national entities.  The RFD has a copy of the emergency resp

onse plan and is familiar with the site.

Planned changes to improve safety:  None

It is our opinion that Carpenter Industries, Inc. is in compliance with all of the requirements of the Risk Management Plan (RMP), as evidenced by this submittal.  The appropriate personnel will be happy to address any questions or comments that may arise regarding this submittal.
